reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that by using the Services, including the Mobile App, information is collected and used as outlined in the Privacy Statement.
reply.reference: By using the Services, you acknowledge that we collect and use your information as set forth in this Privacy Statement. URL: https://mcmillenhealth.org/policies/

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects information about the computer or mobile device, unique device ID, regional and language settings, performance data, network provider, IP address, log files recording website activity, 'hits' data, timestamps, visited pages, time spent on pages, and general information.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy document clearly outlines the types of data collected when the app declares the collection of data.
reply.reference: The app collects information about your computer or mobile device and the network you use to access the Services, software and hardware attributes of the device, unique device ID information, regional and language settings, performance data about the Services, network provider, and IP address, information passively collected in the form of log files, timestamps, visited pages, time spent on specific pages, and general information. URL: https://mcmillenhealth.org/policies/

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that by using the Services, the app acknowledges collecting and using the user's information as set forth in the Privacy Statement, which indicates a declaration of the purpose of data collection and use.
reply.reference: By using the Services, whether by visiting the Web Site, downloading or using the Mobile App, and/or voluntarily providing your personally identifiable information to us, you acknowledge that we collect and use your information as set forth in this Privacy Statement. URL: https://mcmillenhealth.org/policies/

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of receiving materials or other communications by following the provided opt-out link or instructions in emails or text messages. Additionally, the user may customize the communications received through preferences in their user account. Certain personal information can be changed by contacting McMillen Health or by updating the information in their account.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that users have the ability to opt out of receiving communications and can customize their preferences regarding received communications. Personal information can also be changed by contacting McMillen Health or updating the account.
reply.reference: You may opt out of receiving materials or other communications from us by following the opt-out link or other unsubscribe instructions provided in any email or text message received, or by contacting us as provided at the end of this Privacy Statement. You may also be able to customize the communications you receive from us through preferences in your user account. If you wish to make any changes to personal information you have provided to us through the Services, you may do so at any time by contacting McMillen Health. Certain personal information may also be changed by logging into your account via the Services and updating such information. URL: https://mcmillenhealth.org/policies/

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that the app shares personal information with third parties for various reasons, including but not limited to providing services, legal requirements, and data aggregation services.
reply.reference: We share personal information with your consent; as required or permitted by law; for legitimate business purposes; as necessary to complete any transaction or provide you with information or services you have requested or authorized; to obtain your feedback on your App experience; to perform functions or activities on behalf of, or provide services to, McMillen Health; for our proper management and administration or to fulfill our legal responsibilities; to perform data aggregation services in. reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: Google Maps, third party analytics service providers such as Google Analytics

content: third party analytics service providers such as Google Analytics

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly mentions sharing with Google Maps and third-party analytics service providers.
